Tôi - tôi đang lên kế hoạch cho một chuyến quay lại và thực hiện một chuyến du lịch khác vào miền Nam. Một số điều thực sự tạo nên chuyến đi: - Mọi thứ đều đã được lo liệu, từ đồ ăn, xe đạp, khách sạn, v.v. Thật tuyệt khi chỉ cần xuất hiện với thiết bị và chuyến đi của mình. - Hùng đã sử dụng thập kỷ cộng với kinh nghiệm của mình để cá nhân hóa mỗi ngày cho chúng tôi và đưa chúng tôi đến những vùng xa xôi, xinh đẹp, tất cả đều nằm trong vùng thoải mái của chúng tôi khi cưỡi kẻ thù hàng ngày. - Hầu hết những nơi chúng tôi ở đều có view đẹp và kết nối chúng tôi với mọi người. - Xe đạp đẹp quá, tôi đang định mua một chiếc khi về nhà. In a nutshell - 10 days of riding on Honda CFR 250 in Beginning of April. Departing  from Hanoi for a round trip to Sapa and Ha Giang areas. Two friends and a guid. Bottom line -Truly recommend - the trip itself!Highly valuable - Vietnam tour expertsIf you have 5 days - Ha Giang areaIf you have about 10 days - add Sapa as wellInsights -1. A good guide is highly valuable. He knows the way by heart, especially the back roads and the single tracks . No way in the world we would get there by our own. Unless you have the gpx file and a detailed map you need a guide.2. Language wise - where we rode people don - t speak English at all. Not a word. Having a guide to communicate with the locals for any need - food, gas, fun is essential.3. Safety - it takes a few days to understand the way and unwritten laws of  traffic - the guide both explains and rides first to literally protect you from trucks who are the kings of the road in Vietnam.4. Protection gear - most locals Especialy on the North are riding with  flip flops and no helmet. We rode with full protection - boots, helmet, elbow and knee guards, chest protector, gloves. When you fall it protects. You look like a stranger anyway - : - 5. Duration - most of the time you are either on paved roads or on concrete trails. Maybe 5 percent of the trails are really off road and the level of off-road needed is low. Nonetheless, there are cliffs, narrow trails, and all the hazards of the road like any other riding. We found it somehow tiring to ride 10 days in a row. Every day starts at around 8am and ends around 1700 with about 5-6 hrs sitting on the bike. I recommend to consider a stop for refreshing every few days in one of the nice home stays -  hotels  - sapa, ha Giang,Mai Chau  are good options for a stop -  6. Bike - there is no trail  a tough local  can - t ride with their Honda 110 scooters. Still, riding a dual sport bike is more convenient and safe. The XR150 is somewhat in the middle. I wouldn - t save cost on the bike. 250cc will do the job perfectly. No need for more than that.  Vietnam tour experts - ChungWhy book with Vietnam Tour Experts when there are so many other options? Well, we had a very good experience with them, specifically with lovely Chung who helped us willingly while planing and also when there were issues . On the trip when we had a personal issue he immediately responded and found an out of the box solution and didn - t save any effort and resources  to put us back safely on track. He takes full responsibility from the time you land until you  depart and he is highly responsive and efficient.Tips1. Bring a small towel - good for swims along the way - a waterfall, a river, a lake - 2. No need for other shoes than flip lops for the evening.3. Best season for northern Vietnam to my understanding is October-November  - clear sky and mostly dry - . We rode in March-April which is the dry season  - some drizzle can still meet you on the way -  but the air is full with particles so the sun is blocked. In both seasons temperatures are convenient.4. Guide - if you happen to cross the one and only Tu you are settled since Tu is truly number one: -  He is an experienced, responsible, humble guide and first and foremost - a great man! Tu also covers all mechanical issues and he is a talented photographer! A real asset on your team to lead this adventure.Overall impression - an unforgettable epic trip!Read more

reviews: Không khí vui mừng và chờ đợi khi một nhóm nam nữ già trẻ lên máy bay từ Iceland hướng về đất nước Việt Nam xa xôi, thăm một dân tộc mà tôi vô cùng kính trọng, một dân tộc nhiệt huyết và anh hùng. .Cuộc phiêu lưu phía sau một chiếc xe máy đang được hình thành. Từ sân bay, chúng tôi được đưa đến một khách sạn đẹp ở trung tâm thành phố. Sau một thời gian ngắn, chúng tôi gặp hai quý ông - tất nhiên là đi xe đạp - vui vẻ, lịch sự, dễ chịu và thông thạo tiếng Anh. Họ đã cho chúng tôi một lời giới thiệu rõ ràng về chuyến tham quan. Kỳ vọng của tôi tăng lên. Tôi càng phấn khích hơn. Giao thông ở Hà Nội quá tải. Thật là một điều kỳ diệu khi tất cả chúng tôi đều rời khỏi thành phố một cách suôn sẻ nhờ sự quan tâm và hướng dẫn từ những hướng dẫn viên du lịch tuyệt vời của chúng tôi. Chuyến tham quan được tổ chức rất tốt, mọi người đều được chăm sóc và đôi khi được cá nhân hóa theo mong muốn của từng cá nhân và các biện pháp an toàn. Những chiếc xe đạp rất tốt và một người thợ cơ khí thân thiện luôn ở gần - đề phòng. Thiên nhiên trên tuyến đường ở miền bắc Việt Nam thật ngoạn mục, người dân rất thân thiện. Hầu hết thời gian chúng tôi ở trong các nhà nghỉ ở vùng nông thôn, gần gũi với những người bình thường. Nó vừa thú vị vừa mang tính giáo dục. Chỗ ở sạch sẽ, thức ăn và dịch vụ tuyệt vời. I was there together with a friend, we had a 17 days tour around northern Vietnam, from Hanoi to Da Nang. This was a super-cool experience for both of us!!!Me and my friend are experienced road bikers, with only limited experience in off-road, yet we wanted to try something new and not stick to  - bigger roads -  only. This was our first time in Vietnam, I was personally intrigued by the idea of a motorbike tour there since a while. I contacted Motorbike Tour Experts making our level clear from the start, and expressing this wish.Communication was very good all the time, Chung answered our requests  - about one million! -  timely and accurately, so we felt relaxed as the date of the trip approached.In hindsight, the choice of Motorbike Tour Expert was really a perfect one, and I can only recommend them as your travel managers. Both the organization and the day-by-day management of the trip were very professional. The experience was basically hassle-free from when they picked us up at our hotel in Hanoi! They really care for pretty much everything, allowing you to concentrate on the ride, tourism and generally the fun part of it! We settled the payment as previously agreed and we were given new Honda CRF300  - with just a few hundred km on the counter! - , which were totally adequate for our big Western size and bags for 2 weeks and a half. We had all the gear with us  - helmet, boots, upper body and knee protections, enduro suit - , but they can provide some gear in case you need it. Since our trip was open  - start Hanoi, finish Da Nang - , they had our airplane bags shipped to our destination  - a hotel in Da Nang - .As the tour unfolded, we went through surprising, fantastic scenery, incredible stays in homestays in the back country, local markets, waterfalls, caves, high peaks, lakes, temples, real jungles, rope bridges, and more... everything looked like it popped out from an adventure novel or a movie!! Really a 360 degrees experience, diving deep in the local culture and seeing incredible places, pretty far away from mainstream tourism. As a  - serious amateur -  photographer, I could take wonderful pictures with my big reflex camera all along the trip, you can simply stop for a while where you find a scenery which you find intriguing.Food was a full immersion as well! So interesting and tasty, you will try typical food all the time... as a result, I am starting to look for Vietnamese restaurants at home!Our fantastic guide Kim selected a good mix of challenging and relaxing roads, so that we could challenge ourselves and feeling the thrill at one time, and relaxing and enjoy the ride and the scenery at the other. He could speak a perfect English, and never left us alone. We ran into a couple of flats and some very challenging off-road, but we felt he was in control at any time, and we managed to go through everything thanks to his abilities and advice.Concerning the commitment, if you go mentally prepared for  - really -  extreme weather  - very hot and humid, sometime with intense rain -  and you are not new to full days on the bike, you will have an unforgettable experience. And keep in mind that there will be time for relaxation as well - bathing in the middle of a lake at sunset, or in a puddle under a waterfall in the jungle, far from the crowds... and visiting some old temple and town center, just magic!On the choice of the trip, it - s hard to tell since we toured extensively North Vietnam only. I can say that if you like taking your motorbike on mountain roads  - passes, narrow and curvy roads to the top, etc. -  you will not be disappointed exploring the northern part of the country - and this I can say even though I am living close to the Alps! We finished our tour in Da Nang, where the beach looks like Florida, and you can unwind and relax before going back home.I hope to be back soon to explore more in the area, and for sure my first choice will be Motorbike Tour Expert! Thank you for a lifetime adventure!Read more
